alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 4:06PM MST until June 29 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 405 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Jerome area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jerome, Potato Patch Campground, Playground Group Campground and Mingus Mountain Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 89A between mile markers 333 and 350. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oak Wash, Ash Creek, Blowout Creek, Munds Draw, Coyote Spring and Bitter Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
